meta.title: Comprehensive AI Readiness and Policy Development Assessment
meta.description: Exhaustive 100-question evaluation of institutional readiness for AI integration across all domains with policy development capabilities

domains.name: Strategic Leadership & Vision
domains.description: Institutional commitment, leadership support, and strategic planning for AI integration

domains.name: Governance & Policy Development
domains.description: Policies, procedures, governance structures, and policy development needs for responsible AI use

domains.name: Faculty AI Integration & Classroom Policy
domains.description: Integration of AI into teaching, learning, curriculum development, and classroom policies

domains.name: Student AI Use & Academic Integrity
domains.description: Student AI usage policies, academic integrity, and ethical considerations

domains.name: Employee AI Use & Workplace Integration
domains.description: Staff and administrative AI usage policies, workplace integration, and professional development

domains.name: Technology Infrastructure & Security
domains.description: Technical capabilities, infrastructure, and security considerations for AI initiatives

domains.name: Culture & Change Management
domains.description: Organizational culture, faculty/staff readiness, and change management processes

domains.name: Mission & Student Success Alignment
domains.description: How well AI initiatives map to institutional mission, strategic plan, and student success outcomes

questions.question: How would you characterize your institution's current AI strategy?

options.label: We have a comprehensive, board-approved AI strategy with clear goals and timelines
We are actively developing an AI strategy with stakeholder input
We have had initial discussions about AI strategy but no formal plan
Individual departments are exploring AI informally
We have not yet developed an AI strategy

questions.question: Senior leadership actively champions AI initiatives and communicates their importance to the institution
What is your institution's primary motivation for AI adoption?

options.label: Improving student learning outcomes and success
Increasing operational efficiency and reducing costs
Maintaining competitive advantage in the market
Supporting faculty teaching and research
Building reputation as an innovative institution
Responding to external pressure or mandates

questions.question: We have allocated sufficient budget for AI implementation and ongoing operations
How does your institution approach AI pilot projects?

options.label: Strategically coordinated pilots with clear scaling pathways
Centrally managed with standardized evaluation criteria
Department-led with some coordination and oversight
Ad hoc department initiatives with minimal coordination
We haven't started any AI pilot projects yet

questions.question: We have established clear success metrics for measuring AI implementation effectiveness
What is your timeline for comprehensive AI integration?

options.label: Within 6 months
Within 1 year
Within 2 years
3+ years
No timeline established

questions.question: Our AI strategy includes specific provisions for faculty development and training
We have identified AI use cases that align with our institutional mission and values
How do you prioritize AI initiatives across different areas?

options.label: Based on mission alignment and student impact
Primarily on ROI and cost savings
Quick wins and low-hanging fruit first
Based on faculty interest and readiness
By technical feasibility and infrastructure readiness
We don't have a clear prioritization framework

questions.question: Our strategic plan explicitly addresses AI integration across multiple functional areas
How do you handle AI vendor selection and partnerships?

options.label: Strategic partnerships with comprehensive evaluation
Centralized procurement with standardized criteria
Departments select vendors with IT approval
Ad hoc vendor selection without formal process
No formal vendor selection process

questions.question: We regularly review and update our AI strategy based on outcomes and changing needs
Our board and senior leadership understand the long-term implications of AI for higher education
What level of AI transformation are you planning?

options.label: Comprehensive transformation across all operations
Significant integration in key areas
Selective implementation in specific departments
Limited pilots and experimentation
Minimal adoption for compliance or pressure

questions.question: We have established partnerships with other institutions or organizations for AI knowledge sharing
Our AI strategy addresses both current needs and future technological developments
Describe your institution's most ambitious AI goal for the next 3 years and how you plan to achieve it.
What is the current state of your institutional AI governance structure?

options.label: Comprehensive governance with clear policies and oversight
Developing governance structure with some policies in place
Basic guidelines and informal oversight
Minimal governance with ad hoc decision making
No formal AI governance structure

questions.question: We have established an AI ethics committee or review board
How comprehensive are your current AI use policies?

options.label: Comprehensive policies covering all stakeholder groups
Policies in development with some areas covered
Basic guidelines without formal policy status
Informal guidance and best practices
No formal AI use policies

questions.question: We have clear policies for data privacy and security in AI applications
How do you handle AI policy violations or concerns?

options.label: Formal investigation and resolution process
Structured review with documented outcomes
Case-by-case review by relevant administrators
Informal discussion and guidance
No established process for handling violations

questions.question: We have established clear approval processes for new AI tools and applications
How do you ensure compliance with federal and state regulations regarding AI use?

options.label: Proactive compliance monitoring and regular updates
Regular review of regulations and policy updates
Reactive updates when regulations change
Minimal monitoring of regulatory requirements
No formal regulatory compliance monitoring

questions.question: We have policies addressing intellectual property rights for AI-generated content
How do you approach transparency in AI decision-making processes?

options.label: Full transparency with documented decision rationale
Structured transparency for key decisions
Transparency on request or for major decisions
Limited transparency with basic information sharing
Minimal transparency or documentation

questions.question: We have established procedures for regular AI policy review and updates
How do you handle bias detection and mitigation in AI systems?

options.label: Systematic bias monitoring with mitigation protocols
Regular bias audits and corrective measures
Periodic review of AI outputs for bias
Reactive response when bias issues are identified
No formal bias detection or mitigation process

questions.question: We have clear guidelines for human oversight of AI-driven decisions
How do you ensure accountability for AI-related decisions and outcomes?

options.label: Clear accountability structures with designated responsible parties
Defined roles and responsibilities for AI oversight
General oversight by existing leadership structures
Informal assignment of responsibility
Unclear or undefined accountability structures

questions.question: We have policies addressing the use of personal data in AI systems and applications
How do you approach AI vendor contracts and data sharing agreements?

options.label: Comprehensive contracts with detailed data protection clauses
Standard data protection and privacy requirements
Basic security and privacy requirements
Minimal contractual protections
No specific requirements for AI vendor contracts

questions.question: We have established clear incident response procedures for AI-related issues or failures
How do you ensure AI accessibility and non-discrimination?

options.label: Comprehensive accessibility testing and compliance monitoring
Standard accessibility compliance procedures
Basic consideration of accessibility in AI deployment
Minimal attention to accessibility issues
No formal accessibility consideration for AI systems

questions.question: We have policies governing the retention and deletion of data used in AI systems
How do you approach international data transfer and privacy regulations (GDPR, etc.)?

options.label: Full compliance with international privacy regulations
Structured approach to international privacy compliance
Basic compliance with applicable regulations
Minimal compliance efforts
No formal international privacy compliance program

questions.question: What AI governance or policy challenges does your institution face that require the most urgent attention?
How extensively do faculty currently use AI tools in their teaching?

options.label: Widespread integration across most disciplines
Significant adoption in multiple departments
Moderate use by early adopters
Limited experimentation by individual faculty
Minimal or no current use

questions.question: We have clear guidelines for faculty on appropriate AI use in course development and delivery
How do you support faculty in developing AI-enhanced pedagogical approaches?

options.label: Comprehensive training and ongoing support programs
Structured training workshops and resources
Basic resources and peer sharing opportunities
Informal support and individual assistance
No formal support for AI-enhanced teaching

questions.question: Faculty have access to AI tools specifically designed for educational purposes
How do you approach AI integration in curriculum design?

options.label: Systematic integration across programs with learning outcomes
Planned integration in key courses and programs
Department-led curriculum integration initiatives
Individual faculty incorporating AI in their courses
No formal AI integration in curriculum design

questions.question: We have policies governing how faculty can use AI for grading and assessment
How do you ensure quality and consistency in AI-enhanced course delivery?

options.label: Established quality standards and review processes
Peer review and faculty collaboration
Department-level oversight and guidance
Individual faculty responsibility with minimal oversight
No formal quality control for AI-enhanced teaching

questions.question: Faculty receive training on AI ethics and responsible use in educational contexts
How do you handle faculty concerns about AI impact on traditional teaching methods?

options.label: Collaborative approach with faculty input and gradual integration
Structured dialogue and professional development
Open discussion forums and peer sharing
Individual consultation and voluntary adoption
Minimal engagement with faculty concerns

questions.question: We have clear policies on faculty intellectual property rights for AI-assisted course materials
How do you approach AI use in different types of courses (lecture, lab, seminar, etc.)?

options.label: Differentiated approaches based on course type and learning objectives
Guided implementation with course-specific considerations
General guidelines applied across all course types
Left to individual faculty discretion
No specific guidance for different course types

questions.question: Faculty are required to disclose AI use to students in their courses
How do you measure the effectiveness of AI integration in teaching?

options.label: Comprehensive assessment including learning outcomes and student feedback
Structured evaluation with multiple metrics
Basic metrics like student satisfaction and completion rates
Informal feedback from faculty and students
No formal measurement of AI teaching effectiveness

questions.question: We have policies governing the use of student data in AI-powered educational tools
How do you approach AI use in research supervision and mentoring?

options.label: Structured guidance and training for research mentoring with AI
Established best practices and resources
Informal guidance and peer sharing
Individual faculty approach with minimal guidance
No specific guidance for AI in research supervision

questions.question: Faculty have access to technical support for implementing AI tools in their teaching
How do you handle conflicts between AI use and traditional academic values?

options.label: Balanced approach that respects both innovation and tradition
Ongoing dialogue to find integration points
Case-by-case resolution based on specific situations
Minimal formal conflict resolution
Avoiding AI use where conflicts might arise

questions.question: Describe the most challenging faculty policy issue you face regarding AI in the classroom and how you plan to address it.
How comprehensive are your current student AI use policies?

options.label: Comprehensive policies covering all aspects of student AI use
Detailed guidelines with clear expectations
Basic policies covering major AI use scenarios
Informal guidance without formal policy status
No formal policies for student AI use

questions.question: Students receive clear communication about acceptable AI use in academic work
How do you handle AI use in academic integrity violations?

options.label: Clear procedures with specific AI-related violation categories
Adapted existing procedures to include AI considerations
Case-by-case evaluation using general academic integrity policies
Unclear procedures for AI-related violations
No specific procedures for AI academic integrity issues

questions.question: We have clear policies about student data privacy in AI applications
How do you approach AI detection and monitoring of student work?

options.label: Balanced approach with clear detection policies and educational focus
Transparent monitoring with student awareness
Selective use of AI detection tools
Minimal or inconsistent detection efforts
No AI detection or monitoring

questions.question: Students receive training on ethical AI use and digital citizenship
How do you handle different AI use expectations across different courses or programs?

options.label: Course-specific policies with clear syllabus requirements
Program-level guidelines with course flexibility
General institutional policies applied uniformly
Individual faculty discretion with minimal guidance
No differentiation between courses or programs

questions.question: We have clear appeals processes for AI-related academic integrity decisions
How do you approach student AI use in high-stakes assessments (exams, capstones, etc.)?

options.label: Comprehensive protocols with clear restrictions and alternatives
Assessment-specific policies based on learning objectives
General restrictions applied to all high-stakes assessments
Faculty-determined policies for their assessments
No specific policies for high-stakes assessments

questions.question: Students have access to approved AI tools for legitimate academic purposes
How do you ensure equity in student access to AI tools and resources?

options.label: Universal access through institutional licenses and support
Supported access with assistance for students in need
Basic access to free or low-cost tools
Limited institutional support for AI tool access
No institutional support for student AI tool access

questions.question: What is the most challenging student AI policy issue your institution faces, and how are you addressing it?
How comprehensive are your employee AI use policies?

options.label: Comprehensive policies covering all employee AI use scenarios
Detailed guidelines for major AI use cases
Basic policies with general expectations
Informal guidance without formal policy status
No formal employee AI use policies

questions.question: Employees receive clear training on appropriate AI use in their work functions
How do you handle AI use in different employee categories (staff, administrators, faculty)?

options.label: Role-specific policies tailored to different employee functions
Department-specific guidelines with institutional oversight
General policies applied to all employees
Minimal differentiation between employee types
No differentiated policies for employee AI use

questions.question: We have clear policies governing employee use of personal AI tools for work purposes
How do you approach AI use in employee performance evaluation and HR decisions?

options.label: Transparent guidelines with human oversight requirements
Structured approach with clear decision frameworks
Limited use with traditional methods primary
Case-by-case decisions without formal policies
No AI use in HR decisions

questions.question: Employees have access to institutional AI tools that enhance their productivity
How do you handle employee concerns about AI impact on job security?

options.label: Proactive communication and retraining programs
Transparent dialogue about AI implementation plans
Responsive communication when concerns arise
Minimal communication about AI job impacts
No formal communication about AI job implications

questions.question: We have policies protecting employee data privacy in AI-powered workplace systems
How do you ensure consistency in AI use across different departments?

options.label: Centralized standards with department-specific implementation
Coordinated approach with regular cross-department communication
General guidelines with department interpretation
Minimal coordination between departments
No coordination of AI use across departments

questions.question: What employee AI policy challenges require the most attention at your institution?
How would you rate your current technology infrastructure for AI implementation?

options.label: Fully ready with robust infrastructure and resources
Mostly ready with minor upgrades needed
Partially ready with significant investments required
Limited readiness requiring major infrastructure development
Not ready for AI implementation

questions.question: Our network infrastructure can handle the increased data demands of AI applications
What is your approach to AI data storage and management?

options.label: Comprehensive data strategy with dedicated AI infrastructure
Structured approach using existing systems with AI optimization
Adapted existing systems for AI data needs
Basic storage solutions without AI-specific optimization
No specific strategy for AI data management

questions.question: We have adequate cybersecurity measures for AI applications and data protection
How do you approach AI tool integration with existing systems?

options.label: Seamless integration with comprehensive API and data connectivity
Planned integration with standard protocols
Basic integration with manual data transfer
Limited integration capabilities
No integration with existing systems

questions.question: Our IT staff have the skills and knowledge to support AI implementations
What is your approach to cloud services for AI applications?

options.label: Strategic use of cloud services optimized for AI workloads
Planned cloud adoption for AI with appropriate security
Basic cloud services for some AI applications
Limited cloud use due to security or policy concerns
No cloud services for AI applications

questions.question: We have established disaster recovery and backup procedures for AI systems
How do you handle AI system monitoring and performance management?

options.label: Comprehensive monitoring with automated alerts and performance optimization
Structured monitoring with regular performance reviews
Basic monitoring of system availability and usage
Minimal monitoring with reactive problem solving
No formal monitoring of AI system performance

questions.question: What are your biggest technology infrastructure challenges for AI implementation?
How would you characterize your institutional culture regarding AI adoption?

options.label: Enthusiastic adoption with broad community support
Generally positive with engaged early adopters
Cautious interest with mixed opinions
Skeptical with significant resistance
Strong resistance to AI adoption

questions.question: Faculty and staff are generally open to learning about and experimenting with AI tools
How do you address resistance to AI adoption?

options.label: Proactive engagement with education and support
Structured dialogue and gradual introduction
Responsive support when resistance is encountered
Minimal intervention allowing natural adoption
Not actively addressing resistance

questions.question: We have a culture of innovation and experimentation that supports AI adoption
How do you support cultural change management for AI adoption?

options.label: Comprehensive change management program with ongoing support
Structured approach with training and communication
Basic support and resources for adoption
Informal support through champions and early adopters
No formal change management support

questions.question: Leadership demonstrates commitment to AI adoption through actions and resource allocation
How do you celebrate and share AI adoption successes?

options.label: Systematic recognition and sharing of success stories
Regular showcasing of achievements and best practices
Informal sharing through meetings and communications
Minimal recognition of AI adoption successes
No formal recognition or sharing of successes

questions.question: What cultural barriers to AI adoption do you face, and how are you addressing them?
AI initiatives are clearly aligned with our institutional mission and values
How well do your AI initiatives support student success outcomes?

options.label: Directly enhance student learning outcomes and success metrics
Strongly support student success through improved services
Moderately support student success in specific areas
Indirectly support through operational improvements
Unclear connection to student success outcomes

questions.question: Our AI strategy is integrated into our overall strategic planning process
How do your AI initiatives specifically advance your institution's mission and strategic goals?

maturity_levels.name: Emerging
maturity_levels.description: Initial awareness with limited formal structure

maturity_levels.name: Developing
maturity_levels.description: Basic policies and procedures in development

governance.recommendation: Create formal AI use policies for all stakeholders
Establish intellectual property policies for AI-generated content

pedagogy.recommendation: Develop faculty AI use guidelines for teaching
Create policies for AI use in grading and assessment
Require faculty disclosure of AI use to students

student_policy.recommendation: Develop comprehensive student AI use policies
Create clear procedures for AI academic integrity violations
Establish student data privacy policies for AI applications

employee_policy.recommendation: Create policies for personal AI tool use at work
Establish employee data privacy protections in AI systems
